contentrichtext.text: Several ships of the [[United States Navy]] have borne some version of the name '''''Roosevelt''''' in honor of members of the [[Roosevelt family]]. * [[USS Kermit Roosevelt (ARG-16)|''Kermit Roosevelt'' (ARG-16)]], a ''Luzon''-class repair ship that saw service in the Navy during World War II. * [[USS Franklin D. Roosevelt (CV-42)|''Franklin D. Roosevelt'' (CV-42)]], was a ''Midway''-class aircraft carrier, launched in 1945 and struck in 1977. * [[USS Roosevelt (DDG-80)|''Roosevelt'' (DDG-80)]], is a ''Arleigh Burke''-class destroyer, launched in 1999 and currently in service. She was named for both President Franklin D. Roosevelt and his wife, [[Eleanor Roosevelt]]. Three of the ships have been named [[United States Ship|USS]] ''Theodore Roosevelt'', in honor of President [[Theodore Roosevelt]]. {{main|USS Theodore Roosevelt}} * [[USS Theodore Roosevelt (ID-1478)|''Theodore Roosevelt'']] was a steamer built in 1906, acquired by the Navy from the Roosevelt Steamship Company sometime in 1918 and fitted out as a troop transport. * [[USS Theodore Roosevelt (SSBN-600)|''Theodore Roosevelt'' (SSBN-600)]] was a ''George Washington''-class ballistic missile submarine, launched in 1959 and stricken in 1982. * [[USS Theodore Roosevelt (CVN-71)|''Theodore Roosevelt'' (CVN-71)]] is a ''Nimitz''-class aircraft carrier launched in 1984 and currently in active service {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roosevelt}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]] [[pl:USS Roosevelt]]
